Welcome to pyCompFolders’s documentation!¶

Contents:

pyCompFolders.py¶

Compare two directory trees

Background¶

Installation/Usage¶

  • Browse to first folder
  • Browse to second folder
  • Select output folder/file name

Output¶

Columns are:

  • Code
  • FileNum
  • Date
  • Time
  • Size
  • FileName
  • RelPath
  • AbsPath
  • Date*
  • Time*
  • Size*
  • FileName*
  • RelPath*
  • AbsPath*

API¶

class pyCompFolders.ReadDirectoryToList¶

This class does all the work of reading a directory tree into a list Includes the folder navigation and loading of the folder path Returns a list of lists. Each line has the directory elements (time, date, size, name, path).

browseToFolder(startPath)¶
Parameters:startPath – Where to start searching
Returns:Path to the selected folder

Opens a windows file browser to allow user to navigate to the directory to read

deleteTempFile()¶

Delete the temporary file that was created

doReadDir(pathToDir)¶
Parameters:pathToDir – Path to directory
Returns:the directory as a list
formCommandLine(makeDirPath)¶
Parameters:makeDirPath – Path to output file
Returns:The command line

Forms the command line string.

openCSVFile(csvName)¶
Parameters:csvName – Path file name
Returns:file handle

Opens the CSV output file as a CSV writer output

parseDirTxt(filePtr, rootDirPath)¶
Parameters:
  • filePtr – Path to directory text file
  • rootDirPath – Path to root
Returns:

list of directory contents

parse through the text file that was created when the directory was set up
